column2: You've recently finished studying the classics, and you couldn't help but be inspired by the great heroes of the epic poems. Perhaps you should try emulating these mythic figures?
I think I shall!
No point in chasing the impossible...

The greatest heroes were those who took part in the Trojan War. Admirable qualities could be found on both sides of that terrible war, but still you must decide, from which side will your heroic muse come?
The Greeks!
The Trojans!
Of the epic heroes who sided with the Greeks, there were three who stood out as exemplars, which shall you choose to emulate?
I shall endeavour to be like the mighty Achilles!
Odysseus' towering intellect shall be my inspiration.
The honeyed words of Nestor shall guide my life.
Among the many great heroes who defended the walls of Troy, three stood out from the rest, which shall you choose to emulate?
Hector, the great commander!
Aeneas, founder of Rome!
Paris, lover of women!
Emulating Achilles
This character strives to be like the hero Achilles.
Emulating Odysseus
This character is modeling their life after Odysseus.
Emulating Nestor
Nestor's example guides this character's life.
Emulating Hector
This character is using Hector as a guide for their life.
Emulating Aeneas
Aeneas is providing this character a model of life.
Emulating Paris
This character strives to be like Paris of Troy.
Blood of Achilles
This character is recognized as a direct descendant of Achilles. Their presence on the battlefield unnerves their enemies.
Blood of Odysseus

This character is recognized as a direct descendant of Odysseus. Their presence as part of a conspiracy makes others more confident in it's success, and those who conspire against them are less confident in their own success.
Blood of Nestor
This character is recognized as a direct descendant of Geronian Nestor. Their words are respected throughout the known world, and their presence at the negotiating table is an important influence.
Blood of Hector
This character is recognized as a direct descendant of Prince Hector. Their presence in battle strengthens the resolve of their allies.
Blood of Aeneas
This character is recognized as a direct descendant of Aeneas. Their vassals are more confident in their rule.
Blood of Paris

This character is recognized as a direct descendant of Paris of Troy. They are considered more sexually appealing, being descended from two of the most attractive mortals of the mythic era, Paris and Helen.
Achilles Reborn
This character is the reincarnation of Achilles, the mythic hero of The Illiad. Enemy armies tremble at the mention of their name.
Odysseus Reborn
This character is the reincarnation of Odysseus, the mythic hero of The Illiad. All those that dare to plot in this character's realm fear the day they are discovered by this character.
Nestor Reborn
This character is the reincarnation of Geronian Nestor, the mythic hero of The Illiad. All listen with rapt attention when this character speaks, hanging on their every word.
Hector Reborn

This character is the reincarnation of Prince Hector, the Defender of Troy. Soldiers under this character's command believe that they can defend against anything, excepting only the Olympian gods themselves.
Aeneas Reborn
This character is the reincarnation of Aeneas, hero of Troy and founder of Rome. This character's vassals feel secure in the knowledge that they are being led by such a great administrator.
Paris Reborn
This character is the reincarnation of Paris, Prince of Troy. This character is considered one of the most desirable people in the world, the object of sexual and romantic fantasy for many.
